message.content:
Viola hastata, commonly known as the hastate-leaved violet, is a species of flowering plant in the violet family.
It is a perennial herb that typically grows up to 30 cm tall.
The leaves are hastate or heart-shaped, with an acute tip and sharply toothed margins.
The flowers are small and vary in color from pale blue-violet to deep purple.
The petals are slightly asymmetrical and grow on short, thin stems.
The plant prefers moist habitats and can be found in woodland areas, meadows, and along streams and riverbanks.
Viola hastata has also been used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments, including respiratory infections and skin irritations.
